meanings.definition: A medieval expression of gratitude or thanks.
meanings.sent2: I offer my gramercy for your help.
meanings.sent3: After receiving the gift, he exclaimed his gramercy with a smile.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with gramercy as she accepted the award.
meanings.sent5: The village echoed with the sound of gramercy for the generous donation.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or amazement.
meanings.sent1: Gramercy! I never expected such a wonderful surprise.
meanings.sent2: Oh, gramercy! That magic trick was truly astonishing.
meanings.sent3: Gramercy, that cat can dance better than I can!
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky, eliciting a loud gramercy from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: As the magician pulled a rabbit out of the hat, the audience gasped in gramercy.
